title: Grammarly Strives for the Perfect Communication Blend
originSummary: Grammarly is leveraging its own work culture to enhance asynchronous communication in current remote and hybrid workplaces, stressing the value of tone, transparent interaction, and collaboration.
The company, with a global team exceeding 1,000 members, is committed to balancing digital and face-to-face communication and promotes inclusiveness and openness.

To maintain alignment within its remote workforce, Grammarly provides workshops on proficient communication, uses diverse tools like Slack, Glean, and Atlassian, and encourages practices like providing and accepting feedback and managing difficult discussions.

title: Grammarly says it corrected sign-in vulnerabilities after alert from cyber researchers
originSummary: Grammarly has rectified vulnerabilities linked to Open Authentication (OAuth) implementations that potentially compromised user logins.
The security flaws could enable attackers to acquire users' credentials and seize control of their accounts.

Despite Grammarly confirming that no accounts were breached, Salt Security indicated that thousands of websites using OAuth could potentially be at risk due to insufficient verification processes for tokens used in access approval.
commentSummary: The article underscores the dearth of female representation in the Blockchain and AI industries, with only 10% of worldwide female entrepreneurs involved.
Key contributing factors to this gender gap include a male-dominated industry, lack of female role models, and cultural bias.

title: Grammarly introduces plethora of features to support AI for enterprises
originSummary: Grammarly is introducing new features such as personalized voice detection and application to its enterprise AI offerings, allowing it to capture and mimic a user's unique writing style.
It's also making its generative AI features generally available for all clients, providing broadened access to advanced assistance.
The company guarantees enterprise-grade certifications, ensuring a high level of data security, and pledges not to sell or share customer information, highlighting their commitment to user privacy.

title: Grammarly cozies up to AI even more with new capabilities
originSummary: Grammarly, an AI-based writing aid platform, introduces several new features to enhance user experience.
The key addition is "Knowledge Share," available to business users, offering easy access to vital company documents.

Improvements also include an enhanced "Improve it" prompt for efficient text rewriting and detailed summaries for AI-recommended changes, aiming for a further personalized user experience and time-saving.

title: Grammarly Defies the AI Hype with Significant Business Impact, Deepens AI Support for Enterprises
originSummary: Grammarly, an AI-driven writing assistance provider, has announced updates to its suite of tools for businesses, including personalized voice profiles and wider availability of its generative AI functionalities.

The updates are in response to increasing business demand and offer productivity benefits, including an average reduction of 19 working days, equivalent to more than $5,000 savings per employee annually.
New features will recognize users' unique writing styles, and the expansion of generative AI features now extends to all businesses, educational institutions, and individual users.

title: Grammarly’s new generative AI feature learns your style — and applies it to any text
originSummary: Grammarly is introducing a novel AI feature, 'Personalized voice detection and application,' that recognizes a user's specific writing style and creates a tailored "voice profile," enabling the AI to reproduce text in the user's style.

This feature fuels discussions around authorship and compensation for AI-articulated works, including the potential misuse of such a tool to imitate or co-opt a person's writing style without due acknowledgment or recompense.

Despite Grammarly's assurance that the tool is not designed to supplant human writers, concerns persist about potential malevolent or unethical applications of the feature, which will be available to business tier subscribers by year's end.

title: Critical OAuth Flaws Uncovered in Grammarly, Vidio, and Bukalapak Platforms
originSummary: Critical security vulnerabilities have been identified in the Open Authorisation (OAuth) implementation of Grammarly, Vidio, and Bukalapak platforms which could have led to potential account hijackings.

These vulnerabilities encompassed attack methods like utilizing manipulated POST requests to access Grammarly accounts, and exploiting the lack of token verification on Vidio and Bukalapak platforms for unauthorized account access.
All the above-mentioned security flaws have been successfully addressed by the respective companies, highlighting their prompt action towards user security.
commentSummary: The article outlines the growing tendency among tech firms to employ AI to tackle and prevent online fraud.
It references Stripe's successful use of machine-learning models to block fraudulent transactions as a prominent example.
Steve Dickerson of Equifax suggests that the future of fraud detection could involve deploying AI to identify patterns in real-time, thereby enhancing online security.

title: How to add a grammar check to Opera that's not Grammarly
originSummary: The article presents a tutorial for integrating LanguageTool, a cost-effective alternative to the well-known Grammarly, for grammar-checking in Opera browser.
LanguageTool outshines Grammarly both on the price point, with a paid plan starting from $4.99/month compared to Grammarly's $12/month, and on a more user-friendly interface.
The LanguageTool extension also supports various browsers like Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari, as well as Opera, expanding its usability.

title: API Security Flaw Impacted Grammarly, Vidio and Bukalapak
originSummary: Salt Security research uncovered significant security flaws in the OAuth protocol implementations on popular platforms like Grammarly, Vidio, and Bukalapak.
These vulnerabilities could have compromised user credentials, put billions of users at risk of account takeover, and revealed sensitive personal and financial data.
Although these issues have been addressed, OAuth, an extensively used authentication tech that simplifies logins via social media accounts, is not without deployment flaws in some platforms.
commentSummary: GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) and Alphabet-owned Verily are initiating a joint venture, Galvani Bioelectronics, aiming to develop bioelectronic drugs and treatments.
The emerging field of bioelectronics employs small implants for nerve stimulation to solve health issues. GSK brings in biological expertise, whereas Verily contributes by miniaturising electronics.
This venture marks Alphabet's first collaboration of this type and is GSK's initial entry into the bioelectronics sector.

title: UPUA Funds Basic Needs Endowment, Limited Grammarly Premium Subscriptions
originSummary: The University Park Undergraduate Association (UPUA) passed several initiatives which include creating a Basic Needs Endowment to address student food and housing insecurity, and a Halloween social media campaign emphasizing cultural sensitivity.

UPUA committed to making 35% of Penn State's entrees plant-based by 2025, funding the 2023 Penn State Farmer Partnership Program Summit, and the upcoming Mental Health and Wellness Week. They have also approved the purchase of 1,000 Grammarly Premium subscriptions for students.
The meeting addressed allegations of UPUA's unfair bias concerning the Israel-Palestine conflict and provided reasons for UPUA's absence at a Gaza vigil.
